commands.name: az sql mi link create
commands.summary: Create a Managed Instance link between Sql On-Prem and Sql Managed Instance.
commands.syntax:
az sql mi link create --instance-name
                      --link-name
                      --resource-group
                      [--databases]
                      [--failover-mode {Manual, None}]
                      [--instance-ag-name]
                      [--instance-link-role {Primary, Secondary}]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--partner-ag-name]
                      [--partner-endpoint]
                      [--seeding-mode {Automatic, Manual}]
examples: az sql mi link create -g testrg --mi testcl --name link1 --instance-ag-name instanceAg --partner-ag-name partnerAg --partner-endpoint TCP://SERVER:7022 --databases "[{database-name:testdb}]"

commands.name: az sql mi link delete
commands.summary: Drop a Managed Instance link between Sql On-Prem and Sql Managed Instance.
commands.syntax:
az sql mi link delete [--ids]
                      [--instance-name]
                      [--link-name]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--resource-group]
                      [--subscription]
                      [--yes]
examples: az sql mi link delete -g testrg --mi testcl --name link1

commands.name: az sql mi link failover
commands.summary: Performs requested failover type in this Managed Instance link.
commands.syntax:
az sql mi link failover --failover-type {ForcedAllowDataLoss, Planned}
                        [--ids]
                        [--instance-name]
                        [--link-name]
                        [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                        [--resource-group]
                        [--subscription]
                        [--yes]
examples: az sql mi link failover -g testrg --mi testcl --name link1 --failover-type ForcedAllowDataLoss

commands.name: az sql mi link list
commands.summary: Get a list of Managed Instance links in instance.
examples: az sql mi link list -g testrg --mi testcl

commands.name: az sql mi link show
commands.summary: Get a Managed Instance link info.
examples: az sql mi link show -g testrg --mi testcl --name link1

commands.name: az sql mi link update
commands.summary: Update a Managed Instance link replication mode.
commands.syntax:
az sql mi link update [--ids]
                      [--instance-name]
                      [--link-name]
                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                      [--replication-mode {Async, Sync}]
                      [--resource-group]
                      [--subscription]
examples: az sql mi link update -g testrg --mi testcl --name link1 --replication-mode Sync
